description: Shortened form of various related words including vegetable, vegetarian, and vegetate.

examples: The food's lip-smackingly good with some veg options, and there's a ham and eggs breakfast for 3KM.

nouns.description: veg (countable and uncountable, plural vegs or veges or veg)

examples: Secondary foodstuffs are exemplified by the following prepared dishes: vegetarian steaks, gratinated vegs, oven made lasagne, fish and ham with potatoes,  [â€¦]

verbs.description: veg (third-person singular simple present vegs or vegges or veges, present participle vegging or veging, simple past and past participle vegged or veged)

entries.meaning: (colloquial) to vegetate; to engage in complete inactivity; to rest
examples: After working hard all week, I decided to stay home and veg on Saturday.

description: Coined in a 1948 paper in the American Journal of Psychology by Robert S. Harper and S. S. Stevens.[5], [6]

entries.meaning: (psychology) A unit of subjective weight, equivalent to the perceived weight of lifting 100 grams.
